synthesis_conditions.additional_notes: For bulk microcrystalline 1·pX powder, a solution of H2fbdim (184 mg, 0.625 mol) in MeOH/pX (vol/vol = 1/1, 30 ml) was dropwise added into a solution of [Cu(NH3)2]OH (1.25 mol) in aqueous ammonia/methanol (vol/vol = 1/1, 50 ml) while stirring in a N2 atmosphere.

After guest removal, the host transformed to a shrunken structure denoted as 1′ and collapsed above 500 °C. The crystal structure of 1′ was determined by Rietveld refinement of the PXRD pattern, revealing a 38% volume shrinkage compared to the as-synthesized one.
